intro: Pycnocoma elua, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white, often with a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and the plant thrives in cool, moist environments. Pycnocoma elua is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions.
